Topic.Title: Bugs showing verbs and with "clone object and move it"

Posts.EditableText:
Hello! I have 2 strange bugs:

1- use "clone object and move It" (I don't know if is called this way on English): it just don't work. If I use "clone" and then I add the scrip "move" it works but the other one don't.

2- some verbs don't show in the screen or don't work.

 For my game the player have to "read" a manual but the verb ("leer") don't work. I had too change it to "look" ("mirar") or even "read the" to work.  

Then the player can click in a door and see the verbs list but  "open" ("abrir") don't appear. I added some random verbs and they show.

My quest version is from a year (or more) ago so I don't know if those are bugs were common and solved in some new version or are something else.
Posts.HTML:
Hello! I have 2 strange bugs:

1- use "clone object and move It" (I don't know if is called this way on English): it just don't work. If I use "clone" and then I add the scrip "move" it works but the other one don't.

2- some verbs don't show in the screen or don't work.

For my game the player have to "read" a manual but the verb ("leer") don't work. I had too change it to "look" ("mirar") or even "read the" to work.

Then the player can click in a door and see the verbs list but "open" ("abrir") don't appear. I added some random verbs and they show.

My quest version is from a year (or more) ago so I don't know if those are bugs were common and solved in some new version or are something else.

Posts.EditableText: Update: installed the newest version available (I think it was the same) and the problems keep going
Posts.HTML: Update: installed the newest version available (I think it was the same) and the problems keep going

Posts.EditableText:
I have used Clone Object and Move a lot with no problem. And "read" too. I am wondering if this is an issue with your language library?

What language are you using? Yukari sounds Japanese; I am guessing that is not the case. I am wondering if the issue is the language implementation perhaps?
